definition: to open one's eyes/to widen one's horizons

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
broaden, expand one's horizons

sentences.english: Opening my eyes, I saw a big boy glaring at me, a white washcloth in hand.
sentences.chinese: 睜開眼，一個大男孩望着我，手裏拿條白色毛巾。

sentences.english: She had an eye-opening experience that night.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，她可是開眼界了。

sentences.english: He opened his eyes and via his tears looked over at the circle of string he still held clutched in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他睜開眼睛，透過淚水看向他依然捏在手裏的繩圈。

sentences.english: eye-opening experiences compared to the atmosphere of the other institution.
sentences.chinese: 與其他大學比起來，這裏的氛圍使人大開眼界。

sentences.english: Mary grinned at her boyfriend the moment she saw him.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗一看到男友就對他眉開眼笑起來。

sentences.english: And, especially for teenage girls, very eye-opening.
sentences.chinese: 而且，特別是對年輕女孩，很開眼界。

sentences.english: After hearing the results of his exam he walked around campus with a smile from ear to ear.
sentences.chinese: 聽到他的考試成績後，他眉開眼笑地在校園裏漫步。
讓我給你露一手，開開眼。

sentences.english: The sword did its work quickly, and Abanazar never opened his eyes again.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉丁手起劍落，阿巴那扎爾就再也沒有睜開眼睛了。

sentences.english: The delicious food of all over the world there also lets tourists get their eyes wide open.
sentences.chinese: 中外美食更是令人大開眼界，拍手叫絕。

sentences.english: This was truly an eye-opening session.
sentences.chinese: 這是真正令人大開眼界的會議。

sentences.english: He opened his eyes and through his tears looked over at the circle of string he still held clutched in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他睜開眼睛，透過淚水看向他依然捏在手裏的繩圈。

sentences.english: Georgiana opened her eyes and looked into the mirror her husband held.
sentences.chinese: 喬治娜睜開眼睛，在丈夫舉着的鏡子裏看着自己。

sentences.english: I opened my eyes, and saw a blue bed-curtain.
sentences.chinese: 我睜開眼睛，見到的是一個帳子。

sentences.english: Listening to him talk about his adventure in China was a real eye-opener.
sentences.chinese: 聽他談在中國的歷險令人大開眼界。
這次經歷讓我大開眼界。

definition: (usu. of people) difficult/demanding/troublesome/unreasonable/hard to deal with
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
embarrassed
eagle/falcon/hawk
stubborn/willful/pigheaded/Taiwan pr. [zhi2 ao4]
divine light (around the Buddha)/a halo/a miraculous column of light/(slang) jolly good!
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
sensitive/tactful
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
mirror/lens
face
to sigh/to heave a sigh
resentful/angry/to enrage sb
